016package edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.viewmodel;
017
018import android.app.Activity;
019import android.content.Context;
020import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
021import androidx.lifecycle.DefaultLifecycleObserver;
022import androidx.lifecycle.LiveData;
023import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel;
024import dagger.hilt.android.lifecycle.HiltViewModel;
025import dagger.hilt.android.qualifiers.ApplicationContext;
026import edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.service.PermissionsRepository;
027import java.util.Set;
028import javax.inject.Inject;
029
030/**
031 * Provides access (for a UI controller or data-bound view) to the current permissions
032 * state&mdash;that is, to the set of permissions which have been granted by the user. Additionally,
033 * the {@link #checkPermissions(Activity, Set, Set)
034 * checkPermissions(Activity, Set&lt;String&gt;, Set&lt;String&gt;)} and
035 * {@link #handlePermissionsRequestResult(String[], int[])} methods are provided to offload those
036 * portions of the permissions flow from the UI controller.
037 */
038@HiltViewModel
039public class PermissionsViewModel extends ViewModel implements DefaultLifecycleObserver {
040
041  private final PermissionsRepository repository;
042
043  @Inject
044  PermissionsViewModel(@SuppressWarnings("unused") @ApplicationContext Context context,
045      PermissionsRepository repository) {
046    this.repository = repository;
047  }
048
049  /**
050   * Returns {@link LiveData} containing the permissions granted, presumably for observation by a UI
051   * controller or bound {@link android.view.View}.
052   */
053  public LiveData<Set<String>> getPermissions() {
054    return repository.getPermissions();
055  }
056
057  /**
058   * Initiates the permissions flow on behalf of a UI controller. <strong>This method is not
059   * thread-safe!</strong> As a rule, it should only be invoked from a single {@link Activity} in
060   * the app, and only on the main (UI) thread.
061   *
062   * @param activity             {@link Activity} initiating the flow and providing the
063   *                             {@link Activity#onRequestPermissionsResult(int, String[], int[])}
064   *                             callback.
065   * @param permissionsToRequest Empty {@link Set Set&lt;String&gt;} of permissions, populated by
066   *                             this method.
067   * @param permissionsToExplain Empty {@link Set Set&lt;String&gt;} of permissions, populated by
068   *                             this method.
069   */
070  public void checkPermissions(Activity activity,
071      Set<String> permissionsToRequest, Set<String> permissionsToExplain) {
072    repository.checkPermissions(activity, permissionsToRequest, permissionsToExplain);
073  }
074
075  /**
076   * Handles response passed (indirectly) from
077   * {@link Activity#onRequestPermissionsResult(int, String[], int[])}, adding all granted
078   * permissions to a {@link LiveData LiveData&lt;Set&lt;String&gt;&gt;}.
079   *
080   * @param permissionsRequested {@link String String[]} containing all permissions requested of the
081   *                             user by last invocation of
082   *                             {@link Activity#requestPermissions(String[], int)}}.
083   * @param grantResults         {@code int[]} of grant/deny results, in the same order as
084   *                             {@code permissionsRequested}.
085   */
086  public void handlePermissionsRequestResult(
087      @NonNull String[] permissionsRequested, @NonNull int[] grantResults) {
088    repository.handlePermissionsRequestResult(permissionsRequested, grantResults);
089  }
090
091}
